sources.description:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmHgXUJMN1TXEBMtSqYpWfok-xg95KXao
üçïNEW BRILLIANT HD RESTORATIONüçï
Step into the atomic age of sci-fi horror with this cult classic from Gross-Krasne Productions! This thrilling adventure takes viewers deep into the uncharted jungles of Africa, where a scientific experiment gone wrong unleashes a terrifying menace. Directed by Kenneth G. Crane, this black-and-white gem blends science fiction with jungle survival, exploring the unintended consequences of radiation on nature.

The film stars Jim Davis as Dr. Quent Brady, a government scientist who travels to the African interior to investigate a series of mysterious deaths and encounters a monstrous mutation. Barbara Turner appears as Lorna Lorentz, providing a rare female presence in mid-century sci-fi. At the same time, Vladimir Sokoloff plays Dr. Lorentz, a local physician with deep knowledge of the region.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Don‚Äôt forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

Filled with 1950s-era special effects and a haunting score by Albert Glasser, this film remains a standout among genre enthusiasts and vintage horror collectors alike. Whether you're a fan of atomic monster movies or classic adventure thrillers, this is a must-watch piece of cinema history.
